subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Sumer: Where Religion Began
description: A quick, practical guide to Sumer: Where Religion Began.

hook.text: The oldest temples, prayers, and myths all come from one place: Sumer, in modern Iraq. Religion started here.

buildup.text: Around 4000 BCE, Sumerians built the first cities, invented writing, and created the first organized religion.

discovery.text: Their ziggurats were stepped pyramids reaching toward heaven. Priests mediated between humans and the gods above.

twist.text: Sumerian myths shaped the Bible. The flood story, garden of paradise, and creation from clay all started here.

climax.text: Every major Western religion carries Sumerian DNA. The stories we think are original were told 5,000 years earlier.

punchline.text: Sumer wrote the first myths. The Bible echoes them 3,000 years later.

quiz.question: What religion did Sumer influence?
options: Judaism, Christianity, and Islam through shared myths
